intro: Thysanostigma odontites, commonly known as the toothed thysanostigma, is a perennial shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
